name: human_services_data
title: Open Referral UK Application Profile for Human Services Data
description: A specification of the Open Referral standard for Human Services as extended by OpenCommunity and Local Government Association work in the UK. Includes an Application Profile for use with English services.

resources.name: organization
resources.description:
The organization record is used to provide basic description and details about each organization delivering or reviewing services. Each service should be linked to the organization responsible for its delivery. One organization may deliver many services. Note that the LGA extension table 'link_taxonomy' enables many taxonomy terms to associated with an organization. These can define the type of organization e.g.
  • charity
  • voluntary group
  • local authority

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each organization must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The official or public name of the organization.

fields.name: alternate_name
fields.description: Alternative or commonly used name for the organization.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

fields.name: email
fields.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

fields.name: tax_status
fields.description: Government assigned tax designation for tax-exempt organizations.

fields.name: tax_id
fields.description: A government issued identifier used for the purpose of tax administration.

fields.name: year_incorporated
fields.description: The year in which the organization was legally formed.

fields.name: legal_status
fields.description: The legal status defines the conditions that an organization is operating under; e.g. non-profit, private corporation or a government organization.

fields.name: logo
fields.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

fields.name: assured_date
fields.description: The date that the information about the organization was last checked as up to date and accurate.

resources.name: identifier
resources.description: A list of commonly used registers could be provided for the user to select from to cut down number of steps in this process.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: The id of the organization for which this entry describes the registration.

fields.name: service_area_id
fields.description: The id of the servcie_area for which this entry describes the identifier.

fields.name: identification_body
fields.description: The name of the body that uses or issued the identifier e.g. Companies House.

fields.name: register
fields.description: A name to identify the register (e.g. the identifier scheme) that the code has come from.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The registration code or identifier issued by the body.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: A persistent resolvable identifier as defined by UK Government Standards.

resources.name: program
resources.description: Some organizations organise their services into programs. A program brings together a number of related services.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each program must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: Each program must belong to a single organization. The identifier of the organization should be given here.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the program

fields.name: alternate_name
fields.description: An alternative name for the program

resources.name: service
resources.description: Services are provided by organizations to a range of different groups. Details on where each service is delivered are contained in the services_at_location table.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each service must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: The identifier of the organization that provides this service.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: The identifier of the program this service is delivered under.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The official or public name of the service.

fields.name: alternate_name
fields.description: Alternative or commonly used name for a service.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the service.  It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the service

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address for the service

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the service.

fields.name: interpretation_services
fields.description: A description of any interpretation services available for accessing this service.

fields.name: application_process
fields.description: The steps needed to access the service.

fields.name: wait_time
fields.description: Time a client may expect to wait before receiving a service.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

fields.name: accreditations
fields.description: Details of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.

fields.name: licenses
fields.description: An organization may have a license issued by a government entity to operate legally. A list of any such licenses can be provided here.

fields.name: taxonomy_ids
fields.description: (Deprecated) A comma separated list of identifiers from the taxonomy table. This field is deprecated in favour of using the service_taxonomy table.

fields.name: deliverable_type
fields.description: A categorisation of the nature of the output of the Service.

fields.name: assured_date
fields.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked

fields.name: attending_type
fields.description: How to attend this service.

fields.name: attending_access
fields.description: Access restrictions for this service.

resources.name: service_taxonomy
resources.description: The service taxonomy creates a link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each service must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service at a given location.

fields.name: eligibility_id
fields.description: The eligibility item that the taxonomy entry applies to.

fields.name: taxonomy_id
fields.description: The identifier of this classification from the taxonomy table.

fields.name: taxonomy_detail
fields.description: For advanced uses, this field can indicate a constraint on this classification, using * to combine two taxonomy terms. For example: 'Food Pantry*Homeless' (where 'Food Pantry' and 'Homeless' are identifiers in the taxonomy table) to indicate a food pantry service for homeless clients, but not available to other client groups. In this example, there would be two entries in service_taxonomy, one with 'Food Pantry' and one for 'Homeless' in the taxonomy_id field, but both with the same 'Food Pantry*Homeless' value in the taxonomy_detail field.

resources.name: service_at_location
resources.description: The services at location table creates a link between a service and a specific location.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service at a given location.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location where this service operates.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Any additional information that should be displayed to users about the service at this specific location.

resources.name: location
resources.description: The location tables provides details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each location must have a unique identifier

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: Each location entry should be linked to a single organization. This is the organization that is responsible for maintaining information about this location. The identifier of the organization should be given here. Details of the services the organisation delivers at this location should be provided in the services_at_location table.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the location

fields.name: alternate_name
fields.description: An alternative name for the location

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of this location.

fields.name: transportation
fields.description: A description of the access to public or private transportation to and from the location.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

resources.name: phone
resources.description: The phone table contains details of the telephone numbers are used to contact organizations, services, and locations.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location where this phone number is located

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the phone number

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: The identifier of the organisation for which this is the phone number

fields.name: contact_id
fields.description: The identifier of the contact for which this is the phone number

fields.name: service_at_location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the 'service at location' table entry, when this phone number is specific to a service in a particular location.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The phone number

fields.name: extension
fields.description: The extension of the phone number

fields.name: type
fields.description: Indicates the type of phone service, drawing from the RFC6350 list of types (text (for SMS), voice, fax, cell, video, pager, textphone).

fields.name: language
fields.description: A comma separated list of ISO 639-1, or ISO 639-2 [language codes](available at http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php) to represent the languages available from this phone service. The three-letter codes from ISO 639-2 provide greater accuracy when describing variants of languages, which may be relevant to particular communities.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description providing extra information about the phone service (e.g. any special arrangements for accessing, or details of availability at particular times.

fields.name: department
fields.description: (Deprecated) The department for which this is the phone number. This field is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of HSDS.

resources.name: contact
resources.description: The contact table contains details of the named contacts for services and organizations. Note that in the HSDS data package format, if an individual is the contact for multiple services, their details may be duplicated multiple times in this table, each time with a new identifier, and with the rows containing different service ids.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: The identifier of the organization for which this is a contact

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact

fields.name: service_at_location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the 'service at location' table entry, when this contact is specific to a service in a particular location.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the person

fields.name: title
fields.description: The job title of the person

fields.name: department
fields.description: The department that the person is part of

fields.name: email
fields.description: The email address of the person

fields.name: personal_data
fields.description: Whether the record contains personal data to assist compliance with data protection and GDPR purposes.

fields.name: sensitive_data
fields.description: A flag to identify the contact as containing sensitive information that should not be made publicly available.

resources.name: physical_address
resources.description: The addresses table contains the physical addresses for locations. The address fields are in a US form, and some fields are mandatory e.g. city.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each physical address must have a unique identifier.

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the address.

fields.name: attention
fields.description: The person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location (Often included as 'care of' component of an address.)

fields.name: address_1
fields.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

fields.name: address_2
fields.description: (Deprecated) A second (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: address_3
fields.description: (Deprecated) A third (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: address_4
fields.description: (Deprecated) The fourth (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city in which the address is located.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

fields.name: state_province
fields.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

fields.name: postal_code
fields.description: The postal code for the address.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation).

fields.name: uprn
fields.description: A Unique Property Reference Number (UPRN) is a unique alphanumeric identifier for every spatial address in Great Britain and can be found in OS's Address products.

resources.name: postal_address
resources.description: The postal_address table contains the postal addresses for mail to a certain location. This may differ from the physical location.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each postal address must have a unique identifier

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the postal address.

fields.name: attention
fields.description: The person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location (Often included as 'care of' component of an address.)

fields.name: address_1
fields.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

fields.name: address_2
fields.description: (Deprecated) A second (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: address_3
fields.description: (Deprecated) A third (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: address_4
fields.description: (Deprecated) The fourth (additional) line of address information. (This field is deprecated: we recommend including all address information before 'city' as a comma separated list in address_1. There is no guarantee that systems will read this line of address information.)

fields.name: city
fields.description: The city in which the address is located.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

fields.name: state_province
fields.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

fields.name: postal_code
fields.description: The postal code for the address.

fields.name: country
fields.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation)

resources.name: regular_schedule
resources.description: The regular_schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open under normal circumstances. Each entry in the table can relate to one and only one day of the week. Open Referral UK extends this table to add extra fields used in the iCal standard to allow for more flexible scheduling.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the regular schedule

fields.name: service_at_location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the 'service at location' table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

fields.name: weekday
fields.description: The day of the week that this entry relates to

fields.name: opens_at
fields.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

fields.name: closes_at
fields.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

fields.name: valid_from
fields.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

fields.name: valid_to
fields.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

fields.name: dtstart
fields.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the 'interval' feature

fields.name: freq
fields.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

fields.name: byday
fields.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month. E.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month.  -1FR is the last Friday

fields.name: bymonthday
fields.description: iCal - Day number in a month if frequency is MONTHLY

fields.name: description
fields.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

resources.name: holiday_schedule
resources.description: The holiday_schedule table contains details of when a service or location is open during holidays. Each entry in the table describes a period of one or more days, and the operating times on those days. there is potential for this table to be deprecated if iCal rules are adopted in regular_schedule.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the holiday schedule

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which this is the holiday schedule

fields.name: service_at_location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the 'service at location' table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Indicates if a service or location is closed during a public holiday

fields.name: opens_at
fields.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

fields.name: closes_at
fields.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

fields.name: start_date
fields.description: The first day that a service or location is closed during a public or private holiday

fields.name: end_date
fields.description: The last day that a service or location is closed during a public or private holiday

resources.name: funding
resources.description: The funding table describes the sources of funding for a service or organisation

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: The identifier of the organization in receipt of this funding.

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service in receipt of this funding

fields.name: source
fields.description: A free text description of the source of funds for this organization or service.

resources.name: eligibility
resources.description:
The eligibility tables contains details of the eligibility criteria for particular services. Note that the LGA extension table 'link_taxonomy' enables many taxonomy terms to associated with an eligibility. A design principle for the standard is to to be able to identify a small target set of services that closely meet the needs of a prospective service user. The approach to eligibility has been designed to enable a complex set of criteria to be coded so that services can be effectively filtered by a users needs and circumstances.
The design allows for one entry on this table for each set of qualifying conditions - for example
  • Over 60, AND Male
    • OR
  • In receipt of Universal Credit
Each set of AND conditions is then coded into this eligibility structure so that
  • Age ranges use the minimum_age and maximum_age fields
  • Other circumstances are defined as taxonomy entries using the link_taxonony table.
A human-readable version of the coded conditions can also be provided in the eligibility field.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this entry describes the eligibility criteria

fields.name: eligibility
fields.description: The rules or guidelines that determine who can receive the service.

fields.name: minimum_age
fields.description: The minimum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

fields.name: maximum_age
fields.description: The maximum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

fields.name: gender
fields.description: Gender restriction required to meet this eligibility requirement.

resources.name: service_area
resources.description:
The service_area table contains details of the geographic area for which a service is available. Note that the LGA extension table 'link_taxonomy' enables many taxonomy terms to associated with a service_area. These can define the type of area e.g.
  • administrative geography
  • natural neighbourhood
  • town
UK geographies can be referenced in ONS statistical geographies and in Natural Neighbourhoods.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each service area must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this entry describes the service area

fields.name: service_area
fields.description: The geographic area where a service is available. This is a free-text description, and so may be precise or indefinite as necessary.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A more detailed description of this service area. Used to provide any additional information that cannot be communicated using the structured area and geometry fields.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A name for a geographic area.

fields.name: type
fields.description: A categorisation of the type of geographic area.

fields.name: extent
fields.description: A definition of the polygon defining the area, in geojson.

fields.name: uri
fields.description: A persistent identifier to identify an area.

resources.name: required_document
resources.description: The required_document table contains details of any documents that are required in order to access or use services.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each document must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which this entry describes the required document

fields.name: document
fields.description: The document required to apply for or receive the service. e.g. 'Government-issued ID', 'EU Passport'

resources.name: payment_accepted
resources.description: The payment_accepted table contains details of the methods of payment that can be used in order to pay for services

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the services for which the entry describes the accepted payment methods

fields.name: payment
fields.description: The methods of payment accepted for the service

resources.name: language
resources.description: The language table contains details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with intepretation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered

fields.name: language
fields.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

resources.name: accessibility_for_disabilities
resources.description: The accessibility_for_disabilities table contains details of the arrangements for access to locations for people who have disabilities

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: location_id
fields.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the accessibility provision

fields.name: accessibility
fields.description: Description of assistance or infrastructure that facilitate access to clients with disabilities.

fields.name: details
fields.description: Any further details relating to the relevant accessibility arrangements at this location. E.g. whether advance notice is required to use an accessibility facility.

resources.name: taxonomy
resources.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy table contains a list of taxonomy identifiers, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each taxonomy entry must have a unique identifier. If combining multiple taxonomies with overlapping identifiers, use a prefix to distinguish them. The prefix can be a CURIE which must be resolvable by all software consuming the data.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this taxonomy term or category.

fields.name: parent_id
fields.description: If this is a child category in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this should be left blank.

fields.name: parent_name
fields.description: If this is a child category in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the name of the parent category. For top-level categories, this should be left blank.

fields.name: vocabulary
fields.description: If this is an established taxonomy, detail which taxonomy is in use. For example, AIRS or Open Eligibility.

resources.name: metadata
resources.description: The metadata table contains a record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: resource_id
fields.description: Each service, program. location, address, or contact will have a unique identifier. Unique ids are UUIDs.

fields.name: last_action_date
fields.description: The date when data was changed.

fields.name: last_action_type
fields.description: The kind of change made to the data; eg create, update, delete

fields.name: field_name
fields.description: The name of field that has been modified

fields.name: previous_value
fields.description: The previous value of a field that has been updated

fields.name: replacement_value
fields.description: The new value of a field that has been updated

fields.name: updated_by
fields.description: The name of the person who updated a value

resources.name: meta_table_description
resources.description: The meta_table_description table contains metadata about individual tables.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

resources.name: cost_option
resources.description: The cost option table contains the costs of a service at certain points in time. This is an LGA Extension table. This table provides a structured version of the text information contained in the 'fees' field of the 'service' table.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the services for which the entry describes the cost

fields.name: valid_from
fields.description: When this price is valid from

fields.name: valid_to
fields.description: When this price is valid to

fields.name: option
fields.description: Conditions associated with the cost option.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The cost of the option, expresssed as an amount in a currency (expected to be GBP by Open Referral UK).

fields.name: amount_description
fields.description: Specific details qualifying the cost amount, e.g. 'per session'

resources.name: review
resources.description: The review table contains service reviews made by organizations. This is an LGA Extension table. This table provides a structured version of the text information contained in the 'accreditations' field of the 'service' table.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

fields.name: service_id
fields.description: The identifier of the services for which the entry describes a review

fields.name: reviewer_organization_id
fields.description: The id to an entry on the 'organization' table to identify the organization that has provided the review

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the review

fields.name: description
fields.description: A detailed description of this review

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date of the review

fields.name: score
fields.description: The review score

fields.name: url
fields.description: A URL were the review can be read

fields.name: widget
fields.description: Code that can be embedded into a web page to give more information about a review.

resources.name: link_taxonomy
resources.description: This table enables a taxonomy item to be associated with other classes in the model. This is an LGA Extension table. This table enables a taxonomy item to be associated with other classes in the model.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the link taxonomy

fields.name: link_type
fields.description: The class that the taxonomy applies to

fields.name: link_id
fields.description: The identifier of the class

fields.name: taxonomy_id
fields.description: The identifier of this classification from the taxonomy table.
